TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit QualifierData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information about a WMI qualifier.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example lists qualifier information about the **Win32_Service** class using the <xref:System.Management.QualifierData> class. For more information about **Win32_Service**, see the [Windows Management Instrumentation](/windows/desktop/wmisdk/wmi-start-page) documentation.
[!code-csharp[wminet_QualifierData#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WindowsServer/wminet_QualifierData/cs/QualifierData.cs#1)] [!code-vb[wminet_QualifierData#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WindowsServer/wminet_QualifierData/vb/QualifierData.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsAmended { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsAmended : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the qualifier is amended.
Docs.value: Returns a value indicating whether the qualifier is amended.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Amended qualifiers are qualifiers whose value can be localized through WMI. Localized qualifiers reside in separate namespaces in WMI and can be merged into the basic class definition when retrieved.
## Property Value `true` if this qualifier is amended; otherwise, `false`.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsLocal As Boolean
public: property bool IsLocal { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the qualifier has been defined locally on this class or has been propagated from a base class.
Docs.value: Returns a value indicating whether the qualifier has been defined locally on this class or has been propagated from a base class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value `true` if the qualifier has been defined locally on this class; otherwise, `false`.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

member this.IsOverridable : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value of the qualifier can be overridden when propagated.
Docs.value: Returns a value indicating whether the value of the qualifier can be overridden when propagated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value `true` if the value of the qualifier can be overridden when propagated; otherwise, `false`.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
## Examples The following example lists qualifier information about the **Win32_Service** class using the <xref:System.Management.QualifierData> class. For more information about **Win32_Service**, see the [Windows Management Instrumentation](/windows/desktop/wmisdk/wmi-start-page) documentation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the qualifier should be propagated to instances of the class.
Docs.value: Returns a value indicating whether the qualifier should be propagated to instances of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value `true` if this qualifier should be propagated to instances of the class; otherwise, `false`.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Value { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };
member this.Value : obj with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the qualifier.
Docs.value: Returns an value containing the value of the qualifier.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Qualifiers can only be of the following subset of CIM types: string, uint16, uint32, sint32, uint64, sint64, real32, real64, or bool.
## Property Value The value of the qualifier.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
## Examples The following example lists qualifier information about the **Win32_Service** class using the <xref:System.Management.QualifierData> class. For more information about **Win32_Service**, see the [Windows Management Instrumentation](/windows/desktop/wmisdk/wmi-start-page) documentation.
